dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Create mosaic dataset for CADRG/ECRG data.

This tool uses the CADRG/ECRG raster type.

tool.name: cadrgecrg

param.name: workspace
param.dialogReference: Enter the location of the output mosaic dataset. This should be a file geodatabase. You can also pick an existing moisaic dataset name if you wish to add data to an existing mosaic dataset.

param.name: md_name
param.dialogReference: Enter the name of the output mosaic dataset. The output mosaic dataset is created in the file geodatabase specified in 'Output Geodatabase'.

param.name: datapath
param.dialogReference:
Enter in the input data path for the CADRG/ECRG data. This has to be a folder. To add all the data at once specify the root folder of the data. The program will pull the data from all the sub folders.

Adding from multiple data sources:

To add data from multiple source locations, click the file dialog icon and select multiple data source locations.

param.name: datafilter
param.dialogReference:
Specify the file filter of the data to be added. Multiple file filters can be specified using semi-colon as a delimeter. Example: *.GNA;*.GNB;*.GNC.

NOTE: The program does not validate the filter(s) specifed. The filters and syntax are the responsibility of the user.

param.name: useoview
param.dialogReference: Select this option to define and create overviews.

param.name: ovscale
param.dialogReference: Specify the map scale at which to start creating the overviews. For example 1: 100000. This value is then converted to pixel size by the program.

param.name: psValue
param.dialogReference: Read only field to show the scale value converted to pixel size.

tool.summary:
Create mosaic dataset for CADRG/ECRG data.

This tool uses the CADRG/ECRG raster type.
